intro: Borneacanthus mesargyreus, commonly known as the Borneo spurge, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a waxy texture. Borneacanthus mesargyreus produces small, clustered flowers that are usually yellow or greenish in color.
